data.title: Everything offered is delicious...!!!
data.text: There is so much too enjoy...the pizzas are out of this world and I just love their salads...fresh ingredients and not pardon the pun "run of the mill"...

data.title: Pasta, Pizza and Salads....yum
data.text: Love their Jalapeno chicken, BBQ chicken and Thai Pastas....Their salads are large portions and very delicious too! Sundried Tomato Salad is great for garlic lovers and their passion fruit Iced Tea is a must!

data.title: Great caesar!
data.text: The chicken caesar salad was really good! Service was good too. We need to go back....I keep forgetting they have a great breakfast menu.

data.title: The sensais are back in town
data.text: Over a decade ago, 2 fellow martial arts instructors & I had a Tuesday night, post workout, monthly ritual of a couple of beers & pizza at the now closed Oggi's.  After retiring & RV'ing the country for the last 4 years, I felt it time to catch up with the boys.  The Temecula/Murrieta area has some good pizza places.  Deciding on one became a challenge.  Our choice was excellent.  We'd have preferred the outside eating area, but a wedding party had it.  We all zero'd in on Stella on tap.  The 'meat & more' pizza was excellent.  Our waitress is worth recognizing.  She facilitated 3 (now decrepit) old dudes reliving the past.  Being a Thursday night, with always a few tables open, she gave us ample time to talk, sip Stella on tap & eventually enjoy some great pizza.

data.title: Good place for lunch
data.text: The Mill is a mainstay in Murrieta and we have been eating here for 20 years, it is favored by locals.  The salads are huge, enough for two people, beer and wine selection is good.  A relaxing laid back atmosphere and very casual, a fun place to go.

data.title: Very good
data.text: We have been to the Mill quite often. Their Santa Rosa Plateau salad is wonderful!  It's big enough for several people. We usually order a salad for my husband and myself, az do our friends-then take leftovers home, and a pizza for the 4 of us to share. You can get a discount coupon in our local flyer.  We really like the food here and the servers are very friendly as well. Prices are very good.  It reminds me more of a sports bar, as there are tv's and a nice bar area.

data.title: Wow
data.text: I am a pizza lover but I have to tell you, wow! You have to try the Linda pizza! The addition of nuts on a pizza, who knew. Have to say I add olives to it. Never been disappointed!

data.title: Great original food!  I love that the owners are local and involved.  The Santa Rosa Chicken salad is the best!
data.text: All of the pizzas and salads are great!  The portions are generous and service has always been excellent!

data.title: A Murrieta Treasure
data.text:
There is a lesser known area of Murrieta known as Old Town.  It is underdeveloped compared to Temecula,  but there lies it's charm.

Nestled in Murrieta Old Town is a restaurant call The Mill.  It is appropriate for breakfast as well as dinner.  It is a well kept secret West of the 15, by (of all things) the old Murrieta grain mill.

Midrange in price with a decent menu, if you have the time to relax a bit off the beaten tourist path, The Mill is the destination for you.

data.title: $7 for 1.5 slices of bread?!
data.text:
We came here bc I'm a French toast fanatic and this place was recommended. It wasn't good. Basically it tasted like sour dough bread without any batter. And there's nothing included with the French toast...just 3 half slices of bread. Complete ripoff and not even good. And food prep was extremely slow. For $7 I could've bought everything required and made a loaf of French toast at home in the same amount of time.

Other items ordered were mixed. The omelet was good and came with home fries and toast...a meal, decent value. The pancakes with eggs and bacon (or sausage) was barely a meal and also not good. Pancakes were thin and rubbery, not fluffy. 

They only serve breakfast during breakfast hours (until 1130 weekends) so you can't ask for anything else (even though they give you one menu with all food items). There's no grapefruit juice. Ham is thin deli sliced so not worth it to sub for bacon or sausage.

Overall this was a VERY big disappointment for someplace that's highly touted for breakfast. There are 3 other superb, non-chain, breakfast places nearby. We won't be back unless the reviews discuss necessary improvements are made.

data.title: Good Pizza
data.text: Went with friends for pizza and beer. The pizza was really good and so was the salad. I don't drink beer but everyone else enjoyed the beer they offer.

data.title: Poor Food
data.text: We ate here for breakfast.  Food was not the best.  Poor quality and quantity.  I would not recommend this place.

data.title: Good for infomal family dining
data.text:
Had lunch there. The food and service were good, and enjoyed it. The acustics make it a bit noisy, but still O.K. 
There are several eateries close by making for convenience and variety.

data.title: Lunch on a Tuesday
data.text: The Mill shares a parking lot with some other businesses, but there was plenty of parking.  The restaurant could use a little makeover inside but felt clean.  The service was friendly and relatively fast.  I ordered a side salad, a glass of reisling, and a vegetable pizza.  The salad was plain,  the pizza pretty good, and the wine was descent.  For the price I probably wouldn't go back unless my friends or family was already going there.

data.title: Nice Casual Place for Lunch
data.text: Had a small family get-together here at lunchtime.  A wonderful choice and everyone was able to get something they liked.  We did have to wait a bit as it wad crowded, but worth it.

data.title: Always a favorite
data.text: I always start my meal here with a pomegranate martini. Followed by salad, possibly pizza or a pasta dish. Always fresh and good. A casual local place that doesn't require reservations and is reasonably priced.

data.title: Tasty Italian food
data.text: The mill has a wide variety of pasta's, pizza, salads and sandwiches. The service, food and atmosphere is great. We went out for birthday celebrations and the couple we were with are vegetarians, and The Mill offers several selections for them. The portions are large, but not to big

data.title: Just OK
data.text: My wife and I had breakfast here recently because everybody said it's great.  I felt that it was pretty much the same fare you can get at most other restaurants.  Pancakes were OK but nothing to write home about.  The sausage was pretty good.  The breakfast burrito with chorizo was good size with lot's of chorizo but also lots of tortilla.  I wouldn't rush back

data.title: The mill
data.text: Outstanding Italian food an open bar an outside patio to enjoy your favorite meal and great customer service very clean environment you can ask for a better place but then the mill in Murrieta California

data.title: Great lunch spot!
data.text:
In old town Murrietta, this is a local gem!

Great food, salads, etc.  The pizza here is also amazing!  A must eat.
